## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 325, 904, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 400, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 850, 620]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 218, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 70.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>14</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 84, 675, 336]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 357, 717, 377]]<|/det|>
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 419, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 465, 104, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 603, 484]]<|/det|>
The perimeter of a sector of a circle with radius 8 cm is \(26\mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 496, 379, 515]]<|/det|>
Calculate the angle of this sector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 759, 920, 779]]<|/det|>
<form>...................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>21</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 532, 89]]<|/det|>
The graph of a cubic function has two turning points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 638, 104]]<|/det|>
When \(x < 0\) and when \(x > 4\) the gradient of the graph is positive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 544, 120]]<|/det|>
When \(0 < x < 4\) the gradient of the graph is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 118, 406, 136]]<|/det|>
The graph passes through the origin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 256, 166]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[256, 178, 740, 395]]<|/det|>

<label>22</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 454, 710, 655]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 673, 144, 691]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 673, 687, 691]]<|/det|>
On the diagram, sketch the graph of \(y = \cos x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 673, 920, 691]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 702, 146, 721]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 700, 564, 725]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\cos x = - \frac{1}{2}\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[524, 828, 888, 845]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ............................ or $x = ............................$

<label>23</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 656, 95]]<|/det|>
\(y\) is inversely proportional to \(\sqrt{x}\) and \(x\) is directly proportional to \(w^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 91, 301, 109]]<|/det|>
When \(w = 12\), \(y = 12\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 122, 282, 140]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 322, 922, 343]]<|/det|>
<form>y = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 369, 104, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>24</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 761, 388]]<|/det|>
Violet and Wilfred recorded their times to run \(200\mathrm{m}\), correct to the nearest second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 529, 403]]<|/det|>
Violet took 36 seconds and Wilfred took 39 seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 618, 435]]<|/det|>
Work out the upper bound of the difference between their times.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 632, 920, 652]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ s [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 562, 89]]<|/det|>
A bag contains 5 red balls, 4 blue balls and 3 green balls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 143, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 102, 180, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 433, 120]]<|/det|>
Megan picks a ball at random.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 616, 152]]<|/det|>
Write down the probability that the ball is red or blue.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 179, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 210, 180, 228]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 210, 386, 228]]<|/det|>
Megan replaces the ball.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 225, 705, 243]]<|/det|>
She picks a ball at random, notes the colour and replaces the ball.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 241, 395, 259]]<|/det|>
She repeats this 60 times.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 271, 722, 289]]<|/det|>
Calculate the number of times the ball is expected to be red or blue.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 317, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 349, 144, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 349, 631, 368]]<|/det|>
Mick picks 2 of the 12 balls at random, without replacement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 380, 621, 399]]<|/det|>
Calculate the probability that the balls are different colours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 599, 920, 618]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 628, 144, 647]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 690, 647]]<|/det|>
Marie picks balls at random, without replacement, from the 12 balls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 643, 457, 662]]<|/det|>
When she picks a green ball she stops.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 670, 628, 698]]<|/det|>
The probability that she picks a green ball on pick \(n\) is \(\frac{21}{220}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 706, 311, 724]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 907, 923, 925]]<|/det|>
